query:
51. Consider the following statements in relation to Janani Suraksha Yojana :
1. It is a safe motherhood intervention of the State Health Departments.
2. Its objective is to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality among poor pregnant women.
3. It aims to promote institutional delivery among poor pregnant women.
4. Its objective includes providing public health facilities to sick infants up to one year of age.
How many of the statements given above are correct?
(a) Only one
(b) Only two
(c) Only three
(d) All four

solution_notes.summary: The question asks to evaluate the correctness of the statements regarding the Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY). The JSY is a safe motherhood intervention under the National Health Mission, aiming to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality by promoting institutional deliveries among poor pregnant women. It does not specifically target providing public health facilities to sick infants up to one year of age.

sections.title: Overview of Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY)

content.text: The Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY) is a safe motherhood intervention under the National Health Mission (NHM).
JSY aims to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality among poor pregnant women by promoting institutional deliveries.
The scheme provides financial assistance to poor pregnant women to encourage them to deliver in health facilities.

sections.slide_layout: Title slide with bullet points outlining the objectives and scope of JSY.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Understanding the primary objectives of the Janani Suraksha Yojana.

sections.title: Analysis of Statements Regarding JSY

content.text: Statement 1: It is a safe motherhood intervention of the State Health Departments. This statement is partially correct, as JSY is implemented under the National Health Mission (NHM), involving both central and state governments.
Statement 2: Its objective is to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality among poor pregnant women. This is a correct statement and a primary goal of JSY.
Statement 3: It aims to promote institutional delivery among poor pregnant women. This is also a correct statement and a key strategy of JSY.

Statement 4: Its objective includes providing public health facilities to sick infants up to one year of age. This is incorrect. JSY focuses on maternal health and promoting institutional deliveries, not directly on providing healthcare to sick infants.

sections.slide_layout: A table listing each statement with an analysis of its correctness.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Ability to evaluate the accuracy of statements related to JSY objectives.

sections.title: Final Determination

content.text: Based on the analysis, statements 2 and 3 are correct, while statements 1 and 4 are incorrect or partially correct.

sections.slide_layout: Summary slide highlighting the correct and incorrect statements.

assessment_questions.concept_to_be_assessed: Overall understanding of the correctness of statements regarding the Janani Suraksha Yojana.

correct_answer_descriptions: Only two statements (2 and 3) are correct regarding the objectives and scope of the Janani Suraksha Yojana.

accuracy_through_sources: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare reports
accuracy_proof: The objectives of JSY are clearly outlined in the NHM documentation, emphasizing maternal and neonatal mortality reduction through institutional deliveries.
Statement 4 is not a direct objective of JSY, which primarily focuses on maternal health during and immediately after childbirth.
missing_content: Details on the specific financial assistance amounts provided under JSY.
Comprehensive data on the impact of JSY on maternal and neonatal mortality rates over the years.
